poem:
"Fall from the Van of Life"

Oh, the fatal descent, Leah,
From white van's indifferent roar,
To Wakefield's cold mosaic floor.
Huddersfield mourns thee,
A star plucked from summer's sky,
By man's reckless hand, a stone wings by.
The echoes of your halt death knell,
Stir a silence amidst the city's swell.
Lost yet named in bitter tale,
Ever haunting, Denby Dale.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Woman who died after fall from van in Wakefield named as Leah Senior A woman who died after falling from a moving van in Wakefield has been named by police as Leah Senior. Senior, 27, from Huddersfield, was seen falling from a white Transit van on Denby Dale Road on Wednesday evening. A 25-year-old man from Kirklees was arrested on suspicion of causing death by dangerous driving and drug-driving offences. He has been bailed pending". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Woman who died after fall from van in Wakefield named as Leah Senior A woman who died after falling from a moving van in Wakefield has been named by police as Leah Senior.
